agency_desc: A division of the Indiana Family and Social Services Administration that advocates for residents of Indiana long-term care facilities, which includes nursing facilities and licensed assisted living facilities, to promote and protect resident rights guaranteed under federal and state law.
service_description: Receives, investigates, and attempts to resolve problems or complaints involving residents of long-term care facilities (nursing facilities, residential care facilities, assisted-living facilities, adult foster care homes, and county residential care facilities) located in Clay, Parke, Putnam, Sullivan, Vermillion, and Vigo County.
site_details: Call for information, advocacy, referrals, or to make a complaint.
site_eligibility: Persons with questions or complaints about long-term care facilities located in Clay, Parke, Putnam, Sullivan, Vermillion, or Vigo County

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization working to build stronger communities through child abuse prevention, home-based services, youth placement, and recovery services.
site_name: FIREFLY CHILDREN AND FAMILY ALLIANCE - TERRE HAUTE
service_name: COMMUNITY PARTNERS FOR CHILD SAFETY (CPCS) - REGION 8
service_description: Provides a home-based child abuse and neglect prevention program to Clay, Parke, Sullivan, Vermillion, and Vigo County families with children. Services are tailored to meet each individual family's needs and may include case management, advocacy, parent education, and referrals to community resources.
site_details: Call for information; no referral necessary. -- A case manager will come to the home to conduct initial assessment.
site_eligibility: Families with children ages 0-17 -- Experiencing challenges (behavioral, financial, or other source of instability) -- Not actively involved with the Department of Child Services (DCS) / Child Protective Services (CPS), or the Healthy Families program -- If a family has a youth with an open juvenile probation case and the youth is in an out of home placement, the family may receive services as long as they have other children living in the home.

agency_desc: A commercial organization with treatment centers throughout Indiana that provides a 28-day inpatient residential detox and addiction treatment for alcohol and substances, including heroin, methamphetamine, cocaine, and prescription pills. A virtual intensive outpatient program is available for those not needing residential treatment.
service_description: Provides a 28-day inpatient residential detox and addiction treatment for alcohol and substances, including heroin, methamphetamine, cocaine, and prescription pills. Co-occurring disorders such as depression, anxiety, PTSD, and trauma are also treated. Facility has 38 beds.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Self-referring: Call for information or to schedule intake. -- Medical/Mental health provider referring: Call, email or fax referral and supporting documentation.
site_eligibility: Women -- Age 18 or older -- In need of inpatient alcohol and/or substance use detox or treatment -- Medically stable -- Able to complete activities of daily living (showering, dressing, feeding etc.) -- Able and willing to participate in mandatory programming from day one

service_description: Provides faith-based residential treatment program for men who have a chemical dependency. Residents must attend chapel, Bible studies, and be willing to adhere to program rules. agency_desc: A nonprofit child and family advocacy agency with services throughout Indiana.
site_name: THE VILLAGES - CENTRAL INDIANA - TERRE HAUTE
service_description: Offers statewide virtual training for persons interested in becoming licensed for foster care. Foster parents receive 24-hour staff support, counseling services, financial reimbursement, support groups, and respite care. Eligible candidates must be physically and emotionally able to handle challenges presented. Both single persons and married couples are welcome.
site_details: Visit website to complete online interest form, register for upcoming pre-service training dates, or call for information.
site_eligibility: Age 21 or older -- Able to pass a criminal history, child abuse, and sexual abuse registry check -- Able to meet state foster care licensing requirements

agency_desc: A government agency assuring Indiana families with infants and toddlers experiencing developmental delays or disabilities have access to early intervention services close to home when they need them through a coordinated system of local inter-agency councils called First Steps.

site_details: Call for information or to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Clay, Daviess, Greene, Knox, Martin, Owen, Parke, Putnam, Sullivan, Vermillion or Vigo County -- Ages 0-3 -- With, or at risk for, developmental delays

agency_name: BUREAU OF DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES SERVICES - INDIANA DIVISION OF DISABILITY AND REHABILITATIVE SERVICES
agency_desc: A state agency providing services for individuals with developmental disabilities.
site_name: BUREAU OF DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES SERVICES - DISTRICT 4
service_name: HOME AND COMMUNITY BASED MEDICAID WAIVERS / CAREGIVER SUPPORT SERVICES - DISTRICT 4
service_description: Provides funding for home and residential care services to enable persons with developmental disabilities to live as independently as possible. Client services include developmental evaluation; case management; and referrals to supported living, sheltered employment, and home-care providers. There is a wait list for Medicaid Waivers; however, caregiver support services funds may be available in the meantime.
site_details: Call for information or to request an application.
site_eligibility: With a developmental disability, including intellectual disability, cerebral palsy, epilepsy, autism, down syndrome, or a condition that results in a similar impairment -- Onset for the condition was prior to age 22 -- The disability creates substantial functional limitations (determined by assessment)

service_description: Provides funding for home and residential care services to enable persons with developmental disabilities to live as independently as possible. Client services include developmental evaluation; case management; and referrals to supported living, sheltered employment, and home-care providers. There is a wait list for Medicaid Waivers; however, caregiver support services funds may be available in the meantime.
site_details: Call for information or to request an application.
site_eligibility: With a developmental disability, including intellectual disability, cerebral palsy, epilepsy, autism, down syndrome, or a condition that results in a similar impairment -- Onset for the condition was prior to age 22 -- The disability creates substantial functional limitations (determined by assessment)

agency_name: BUREAU OF DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES SERVICES - INDIANA DIVISION OF DISABILITY AND REHABILITATIVE SERVICES

agency_desc: A nonprofit counseling service for individuals with problems of violence or abusive behavior. Offers an Indiana Coalition Against Domestic Violence Certified Batterers Intervention Program.
site_name: CERTIFIED BATTERER'S INTERVENTION PROGRAM - TERRE HAUTE
service_name: CERTIFIED BATTERER'S INTERVENTION PROGRAM - TERRE HAUTE
service_description: Provides classes on recognizing and changing patterns of problematic or abusive behavior for men and women who use violence or other abusive behavior in relationships. Participants may self-refer, be court-ordered, or referred by the Department of Child Services (DCS). This 26-week program is certified by the Indiana Coalition Against Domestic Violence (ICADV). Clients may begin the program at any time.
site_details: Call to schedule orientation before going. (Persons with a court-order must attend an orientation session to meet court requirements.)
site_eligibility: Men and women who use violence in relationships -- Age 18 or older or age 17 or younger with parent/guardian permission

agency_desc: A commercial organization with a treatment center that provides a 28-day inpatient residential detox and addiction treatment for alcohol and substances.
service_description: Provides a 28-day inpatient residential detox and addiction treatment for alcohol and substances.
taxonomy_name: Inpatient Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel4: Inpatient Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
site_details: Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older -- If pregnant, must be under 7 months pregnant -- In need of inpatient alcohol and/or substance use detox or treatment -- Medically stable -- Able to complete activities of daily living (showering, dressing, feeding etc.) -- Able and willing to participate in mandatory programming from day one

agency_name: BOY SCOUTS OF AMERICA - CROSSROADS OF AMERICA COUNCIL
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization with a strong focus on the outdoors and survival skills that aims to support young people in their physical, mental, and spiritual development so that they may play constructive roles in society.
site_name: BOY SCOUTS OF AMERICA - CROSSROADS OF AMERICA COUNCIL - TERRE HAUTE
service_description: Promotes development and leadership for boys through group skill-building activities, outdoor recreation, and community service projects. This council includes scouting units in the following counties:  Boone, Clinton, Fayette, Franklin, Hamilton, Hancock, Hendricks, Johnson, Madison, Marion, Monroe, Montgomery, Rush, Shelby, Tipton, Union, Vermillion, and Wayne.
site_details: Call the council office for information about joining the nearest scout unit.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8:30am-5pm -- Scout Shop: Mon, Wed, and Fri 8:30am-5pm; Tues and Thurs 8:30am-7pm; Sat 9am-3pm -- Program: Vary
site_eligibility: Cub Scouts: Age 7-10 years-old -- Boy Scouts: Age 11-18 years-old

agency_desc:
Seeks to match lower income residents of Clay, Greene, Hendricks, Lawrence, Monroe, Morgan, Owen, Putnam, Sullivan, and Vigo County with local volunteer attorneys for free legal assistance.

Intake applications taken: Tuesdays 5-7pm and Thursdays 11am-1pm
site_name: DISTRICT 10 PRO BONO PROJECT - VIGO COUNTY
service_description: Offers free legal advice and possible representation for persons experiencing domestic violence.
site_details: Clients can access this service by calling (812)269-6463, and if the attorney isn't available to answer, by leaving a message for a call back or to request a zoom session.
site_eligibility: Living in or have a case in Clay, Sullivan, or Vigo County -- Persons experiencing domestic violence -- Income at or below 120% of the Federal Poverty Guidelines

agency_desc:
Seeks to match lower income residents of Clay, Greene, Hendricks, Lawrence, Monroe, Morgan, Owen, Putnam, Sullivan, and Vigo County with local volunteer attorneys for free legal assistance.

Intake applications taken: Tuesdays 5-7pm and Thursdays 11am-1pm
site_name: DISTRICT 10 PRO BONO PROJECT - VIGO COUNTY
service_description: Offers a walk-in legal clinic where people without legal counsel can speak with volunteer attorneys and law students about family law and get help with paperwork. Consultation only; no legal representation available.
site_details: Clients can access this service by calling (812)269-6463, and if the attorney isn't available to answer, by leaving a message for a call back or to request a zoom session.
site_eligibility: Have a case pending in Clay, Greene, Hendricks, Lawrence, Monroe, Morgan, Owen, Putnam, Sullivan, or Vigo County -- Able to meet income guidelines; generally 125% of federal poverty guidelines -- Have a civil case that requires an attorney -- Not currently represented by an attorney

agency_desc: A full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Provides mental and physical health care referrals, care coordination, medical case management, and facilitates peer support groups for HIV positive individuals. Established patients may also be eligible for assistance with nutritional food, job search, securing stable housing, and navigating financial and medical benefits applications.
site_details: Call for information, or to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Provides free, confidential HIV testing by appointment or on a walk-in basis.
site_details: Call or email to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open (parental consent required for those age 13 or younger)

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in Knox County.
service_description: Maintains records of all county-level court cases, and issues marriage licenses. Files petitions for divorce, probate, adoption, name change, child custody, parental visitation, record expungement, and protective orders. Processes payments for child support, foreclosures, court costs, and other judgments. Oversees elections in the county.
site_details: Call or walk in for information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves Knox County

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in Knox County.
service_description: Issues, provides, and maintains marriage licenses issued in the county. No witnesses, blood tests, or waiting period are required to obtain one. Both applicants must appear at the time of application. Marriages must take place within 60 days of the marriage license being issued.
site_details: Walk in. Marriage license forms may be completed in advance online or in the clerk's office.
site_eligibility: Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in Knox County.
service_description: Serves as a voter registration site and provides information about voting, candidates, absentee voting, and volunteering to work the polls. Oversees county-level elections, candidate filings, and campaign finance.
site_details: Call for information -- Walk in or visit website to register
site_eligibility: Registering to vote: United States citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in Knox County.
service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in the county and provides records of payment history. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with this office; any changes must be made in writing.
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_schedule: Clerk's Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

agency_name: BUREAU OF REHABILITATION SERVICES - INDIANA DIVISION OF DISABILITY AND REHABILITATIVE SERVICES
agency_desc: A state agency Bureau that serves persons with disabilities so that they may achieve and maintain employment.
service_description: Provides a range of employment services for persons with physical or mental impairment. Applicants receive assessment to determine eligibility and vocational rehabilitation needs. Eligible persons may receive counseling and guidance, referrals to vocational training and placement programs, and funding for rehabilitation services as appropriate to achieve an employment goal.
site_details: Call for information, to apply for services, and/or to discuss your employment needs.
site_eligibility: Have a physical or mental impairment that, based on assessment, constitutes or results in a substantial impediment to employment -- Requiring vocational rehabilitation services to prepare for, enter, engage in, or retain appropriate employment

agency_desc: The state government entity responsible for state tax matters, including collecting state taxes, administering state tax laws, and creating tax policy.
site_name: INDIANA DEPARTMENT OF REVENUE - TERRE HAUTE DISTRICT
service_description: Answers questions about state income taxes, provides state tax forms, handles state tax collections and assists with setting up payment arrangements, and submits completed state tax returns (paper filing only). Assistance is provided by phone, email, or on a walk-in basis. Automated information is available 24 hours per day by phone.
site_details: Walk in, call, or send questions by email. -- For phone assistance, follow the phone prompts to hear recorded information by topic or to speak with a live representative. State or federal tax ID number may be required.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Files, modifies, and enforces court-ordered child support cases in Vigo County.
site_details: To apply for child support or request child support enforcement or modification, walk in to   pick up an application or call to schedule an appointment. -- For payment information, call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-noon and 1pm-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: To File for Child Support Assistance: Living in Vigo County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Files, modifies, and enforces court-ordered child support cases in Vigo County.
site_details: To apply for child support or request child support enforcement or modification, walk in to   pick up an application or call to schedule an appointment. -- For payment information, call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-noon and 1pm-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: To File for Child Support Assistance: Living in Vigo County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Investigates allegations of abuse, neglect, self-neglect, and exploitation of endangered adults (adults who are incapable of caring for themselves or managing their property due to physical or mental incapacity.) Indiana law requires persons to report all cases of suspected abuse, neglect, or exploitation of an endangered adult to the nearest Adult Protective Services office or to law enforcement agents. All reports are confidential.
site_details: Call to make a report; provide as much detail about the situation as possible. -- For emergencies or after-hours reports, please call local police or county dispatch.
site_eligibility: Persons who suspect abuse, neglect, self-neglect, or exploitation of an endangered adult.

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Provides advocacy, information, referrals, and support services to crime victims and witnesses and victims of domestic violence in Vigo County. Assists in the filing of restraining or protective orders and developing a safety plan. Provides information about case status, victim compensation, victim rights, and the legal process.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Living in Vigo County -- Victims of domestic violence and/or major crimes in Vigo County

service_description: Provides advocacy, information, referrals, and support services to crime victims and witnesses and victims of domestic violence in Vigo County. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit organization providing shelter and support services for area persons in need.
service_description: Offers a shelter for homeless men and married couples with or without children. Support services available; chapel attendance is required.
site_details: Call for intake.
site_eligibility: Men age 18 or older -OR- married couples with or without children -- Able to climb one flight of stairs to enter building (elevator available inside the shelter) -- Not under the influence of drugs or alcohol (drug test not required, random drug tests are still in affect)

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit organization providing shelter and support services for area persons in need.
service_description: Provides breakfast, lunch, and dinner every day of the year. Open to all in need.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit organization providing shelter and support services for area persons in need.
service_description: Offers shelter for homeless women with or without children. Support services available; chapel attendance is required.
site_details: Call for intake.
site_eligibility: Women age 18 or older -- Without or with children (boys and girls up to age 18)

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit organization providing shelter and support services for area persons in need.
site_name: LIGHT HOUSE MISSION THRIFT STORE - TERRE HAUTE NORTH
service_description: Offers donated clothing, shoes, and small household items for sale at discount prices. All proceeds support the agency's soup kitchen, homeless shelters, and other human service programs.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Open service area.
site_details: Call and schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: Mon and Fri 1:30pm-3:30pm; by appointment only
site_eligibility: Open -- Limit one (1) visit every 30 days

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect the health and safety of persons living in Vigo County. Regulates drainage and septic systems, public swimming pools and hot tubs, tattoo parlors, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, and air and water pollution. Offers information and referrals regarding household environmental hazards such as mold, radon, and water contamination, and provides lead testing.
site_details: Call or walk in for information, to request services, or to make a report.
site_eligibility: Varies by service

site_eligibility: Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate

service_description: Provides low-cost or free immunizations for County youth (through age 18) who are uninsured, whose insurance does not cover the required vaccination, or who are enrolled in Medicaid. Also provides immunizations for American Indians and Alaskan Natives under age 18 regardless of their insurance status. All school-required vaccines are available, as well as the HPV vaccine.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_eligibility: Living in Vigo County -- Age 2 months through 18 years-old -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides services to alleviate poverty, improve living conditions, and provide access to health care and social services to those in need.
site_name: WESTERN INDIANA COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY - VIGO COUNTY
service_description: Provides no-cost medical care for eligible low-income households struck by illness and unable to afford treatment due to a lack of insurance coverage. This program coordinates with Vigo County physicians, specialists, hospitals, clinics, laboratories, and testing facilities to provide donated services. Limited assistance for prescription medication is sometimes available depending on donations.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility:
Living in Clay, Putnam, or Vigo Counties
Household income at or below 125% Federal Poverty Guidelines 
Uninsured, with physician/clinic referral for necessary medical testing or treatment -OR- valid prescription from a physician

site_name: CATHOLIC CHARITIES TERRE HAUTE FOOD BANK
service_description: Provides USDA food boxes once a month to Vigo County residents age 60 or older who meet the 2023 gross household income guidelines.
site_details: To Register: Walk in to complete an application -OR- visit the website to print and complete an application -- Applications can be accessed at  https://www.ccthin.org/emergency-food-assistance. Scroll down and click on Fillable Application. -- Applications must be submitted in person.
site_eligibility: Living in Vigo County -- Age 60 or older -- Income guidelines: Household Size (1) $18,954 - (2) $25,636 - (3) $32,318 - (4) $39,000 - (5) $45,682 - For each additional family member, add: $6,682/year

service_description: Assists seniors and persons with disabilities in applying for and accessing funding for supportive living services. Funding options may include Medicaid Waivers, CHOICE vouchers, or block grants. Ongoing case management, care coordination, and in-home services are provided for those who qualify. In some cases, subsidies may be used to pay a family member to provide the care.

Addressing PTSD (post-traumatic stress disorder), substance abuse, lack of education, and joblessness are all areas they may be addressed.

site_eligibility: Veterans (all branches) and their families -- Commitment to maintaining sobriety

agency_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF WABASH VALLEY
agency_desc: A nonprofit Christian housing ministry that builds and renovates affordable housing for qualified individuals and families.
site_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF WABASH VALLEY
service_description: Builds and sells homes for eligible low-income persons in Vigo County. Participants contribute a set number of hours of labor ("sweat equity") toward the construction of a dwelling that they may then purchase through a zero-interest, low monthly payment loan. Volunteer opportunities are also available for interested individuals and service groups.
site_details: Call to request a pre-application.
site_eligibility: Household income between 30%-80% of area median (Call or see website for current amounts.) -- Able to pay a monthly mortgage payment and small down payment

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Maintains a secure residential facility for minors awaiting court hearings or long-term placement. Detention is for the purpose of ensuring the safety of the child or the community and to ensure that the accused appears at hearings.  Juveniles who cannot afford a private attorney may request a public defender at their initial hearing.
site_details: Call to check the status of a detainee.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or younger -- Ordered by the courts for detention

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Provides probation services for the county Juvenile Courts, including supervising juvenile offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.
site_details: Through the courts; call for information.
site_eligibility: Juvenile offenders assigned to probation by the Vigo County Courts

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Oversees court cases involving county minors, including petitions for emancipation, children in need of services (CHINS), and minors accused of delinquency or status offenses. The Juvenile Center includes the Juvenile Court, Juvenile Detention Center, and Juvenile Probation Department.
site_details: By court order; parents cannot self-refer children to juvenile court
site_eligibility: Vigo County juveniles age 17 or under

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Provides protective orders for juvenile victims of domestic or family violence, stalking, or a sex offense. Protective orders provide legal restrictions on the contact that named individuals may have with the petitioner (the person requesting the order). There is no cost involved, and orders are issued or denied the same day they are filed.
site_details: Walk in to the court to complete paperwork (allow 1-2 hours). Paperwork completed by 4pm will be filed the same day. Advocates may be available to provide assistance. -- Protective orders are typically issued or denied on the same day they are filed. Petitioners may be notified by text or email -- Call to find out the status of a petition.
site_eligibility: Filing for protection regarding events that took place in Vigo County -- A parent or guardian filing on behalf of a juvenile age 0-17 -- Person named in the order has attempted to cause, threatened to cause, or is causing physical harm to the juvenile or is placing the juvenile in fear of physical harm -- Person named in the order is a current or former intimate partner of the juvenile: is related to the juvenile by blood or marriage, has committed or is threatening a sex offense against the juvenile, or is engaged in stalking the juvenile -- Able to provide the full name and address of the person from whom protection is being sought; date of birth or Social Security number is helpful but not required

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $6,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $1,500. In Vigo County, Superior Courts 4 and 5 handle small claims cases.
site_details: Call, walk in, or visit the website for more information or claim forms.
site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $6,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Vigo County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Vigo County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in Vigo County

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Oversees both criminal and civil trials, including juvenile and family cases. This county has one circuit court and six superior courts.
site_details: Varies; cases are generally initiated through the prosecutors office, private attorneys, or individuals representing themselves. For juror information, contact Jury Information Line.
site_eligibility: Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Provides protective orders for victims of domestic or family violence, stalking, or a sex offense. Protective orders provide legal restrictions on the contact that named individuals may have with the petitioner (the person requesting the order). There is no cost involved, and orders are issued or denied the same day they are filed.
site_details: Walk in to the court to complete paperwork (allow 1-2 hours). Paperwork completed by 4pm will be filed the same day. Advocates may be available to provide assistance. -- Protective orders are typically issued or denied on the same day they are filed. Petitioners may be notified by text or email -- They can call to find out the status of a petition.
site_eligibility: Filing protection regarding events that took place in Vigo County -- Age 18 or older -- Person named in the order has attempted to cause, threatened to cause is: causing physical harm to the petitioner or is placing the petitioner in fear of   physical harm -- Person named in the order is a current or former intimate partner of the petitioner, is related to the petitioner by blood or marriage -- has committed or is threatening a sex offense against the petitioner -- is engaged in stalking the petitioner. Able to provide the full name and address of the person from whom protection is being sought; date of birth or Social Security number is helpful but not required

site_eligibility: Diagnosed mental illness -- Homeless -- Low- or no-income

service_name: PREGNANCY SUPPORT - CHILD AND ADOLESCENT SERVICES - VIGO COUNTY
service_description: Provides comprehensive, home-based services to women and families who are expecting or who have newborns. This voluntary program focuses on strengthening at-risk families through parent education, support, and advocacy.
site_details: Call to complete the initial screening process. If initial qualifications are met, a home visit will be scheduled for a needs assessment.
site_eligibility: Living in Greene, Sullivan, Vermillion, or Vigo County -- Pregnant or parent of a baby under 90 days old (initial contact should be made by the time the baby is 75 days old) -- At or below 250% Federal Poverty Guidelines (other risk factors may be considered) -- Active program participant (baby or parent) must have Social Security number

agency_desc: Oversees all voter registration and maintains voter filings in Vigo County.
service_description: Oversees the administration of all county-level elections in the county. This office and website also serves as a voter registration, and working the polls.
site_details: To register to vote, walk in or register online at www.indianavoters.com. For election information, call this office or visit the website.
site_eligibility: To register to vote in this county: United States citizens -- Living in this county -- At least 18 years old on the day of the next election -- Not currently imprisoned after being convicted of a crime -- To vote in in this county: Registered in current precinct at least 29 days before the election

agency_name: INDIANA UNIVERSITY SCHOOL OF MEDICINE - TERRE HAUTE AT INDIANA STATE UNIVERSITY
agency_desc: Educates and prepare future rural healthcare workers by enriching and caring for the underserved population in our community in an interprofessional environment.
service_description: Offers a free, student-run health clinic for people in need. Provides primary health care services, including treatment for acute and chronic conditions, physical exams, basic health screenings, health education, and medication list explanation. Services are provided by medical students under the supervision of a physician.
site_details: Call or visit website to schedule an appointment; walk-ins accepted on a first come, first served basis.
site_schedule: Sat 8am-noon -- 2023: Feb 4, Feb 18, Mar 4, Mar 18, Apr 8, Apr 22, May 6, May 20, Jun 3, Jun 17, Jul 8, Jul 22, Aug 5, Aug 19
site_eligibility: Open
